Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Downhill \Down"hill`\, adv. Towards the bottom of a hill; as, water runs downhill. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Downhill \Down"hill`\, a. Declivous; descending; sloping. ``A downhill greensward.'' --Congrewe. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Downhill \Down"hill`\, n. Declivity; descent; slope. [1913 Webster]
On th' icy downhills of this slippery life. --Du Bartas (Trans. ). [1913 Webster]

downhill adj : sloping down rather steeply [syn: {declivitous}, {downward-sloping}] n 1: the downward slope of a hill 2: a ski race down a trail adv 1: toward a lower or inferior state; "your performance has been going downhill for a long time now" 2: toward the bottom of a hill; "running downhill, he gained a lot of speed"
